intro: Heimia longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed heimia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and slightly woody at the base. Heimia longipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
